Name: Transaction
EnhancedDefinition: Provides further details on an entry in the report.

Name: AccountId
EnhancedDefinition: A unique and immutable identifier used to identify the account resource. This identifier has no meaning to the account owner.

Name: TransactionId
EnhancedDefinition: Unique identifier for the transaction within an servicing institution. This identifier is both unique and immutable.

Name: TransactionReference
EnhancedDefinition: Unique reference for the transaction. This reference is optionally populated, and may as an example be the FPID in the Faster Payments context.

Name: Amount
EnhancedDefinition: Amount of money in the cash transaction entry.

Name: Currency
EnhancedDefinition: A code allocated to a currency by a Maintenance Agency under an international identification scheme, as described in the latest edition of the international standard ISO 4217 "Codes for the representation of currencies and funds".

Name: CreditDebitIndicator
EnhancedDefinition: Indicates whether the transaction is a credit or a debit entry.

Name: Status
EnhancedDefinition: Status of a transaction entry on the books of the account servicer.

Name: BookingDateTime
EnhancedDefinition:
Date and time when a transaction entry is posted to an account on the account servicer's books.

Usage: Booking date is the expected booking date, unless the status is booked, in which case it is the actual booking date.

Name: ValueDateTime
EnhancedDefinition:
Date and time at which assets become available to the account owner in case of a credit entry, or cease to be available to the account owner in case of a debit transaction entry.
Usage: If transaction entry status is pending and value date is present, then the value date refers to an expected/requested value date.
For transaction entries subject to availability/float and for which availability information is provided, the value date must not be used. In this case the availability component identifies the number of availability days.

Name: TransactionInformation
EnhancedDefinition:
Further details of the transaction. 
This is the transaction narrative, which is unstructured text.

Name: AddressLine
EnhancedDefinition: Information that locates and identifies a specific address for a transaction entry, that is presented in free format text.

Name: BankTransactionCode
EnhancedDefinition: Set of elements used to fully identify the type of underlying transaction resulting in an entry.

Name: Code
EnhancedDefinition: Specifies the family within a domain.

Name: SubCode
EnhancedDefinition: Specifies the sub-product family within a specific family.

Name: ProprietaryBankTransactionCode
EnhancedDefinition: Set of elements to fully identify a proprietary bank transaction code.

Name: Code
EnhancedDefinition: Proprietary bank transaction code to identify the underlying transaction.

Name: Issuer
EnhancedDefinition: Identification of the issuer of the proprietary bank transaction code.

Name: Balance
EnhancedDefinition: Set of elements used to define the balance as a numerical representation of the net increases and decreases in an account after a transaction entry is applied to the account.

Name: Amount
EnhancedDefinition: Amount of money of the cash balance after a transaction entry is applied to the account..

Name: Currency
EnhancedDefinition: A code allocated to a currency by a Maintenance Agency under an international identification scheme, as described in the latest edition of the international standard ISO 4217 "Codes for the representation of currencies and funds".

Name: CreditDebitIndicator
EnhancedDefinition:
Indicates whether the balance is a credit or a debit balance. 
Usage: A zero balance is considered to be a credit balance.

Name: Type
EnhancedDefinition: Balance type, in a coded form.
Codes:
ClosingAvailable
ClosingBooked
Expected
ForwardAvailable
Information
InterimAvailable
InterimBooked
OpeningAvailable
OpeningBooked
PreviouslyClosedBooked

Name: MerchantDetails
EnhancedDefinition: Details of the merchant involved in the transaction.

Name: MerchantName
EnhancedDefinition: Name by which the merchant is known.

Name: MerchantCategoryCode
EnhancedDefinition: Category code conform to ISO 18245, related to the type of services or goods the merchant provides for the transaction.
